posts.post_content:
Ok, wait.  
4/4 body plus first stike equates to about five mana, right?  
So since this creature has a mana cost of ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol), a further little ability shouldn't be a bad idea. And this ability we're talking about is...a drawback?! Something went wrong here.  
  
I know this is part of a mechanic cycle from Planeshift called "gating" which can be made profitable, but white and green are both colors for weenie decks *(as seen on [Watchwolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Watchwolf) for example)*, so why did they not reduce the cost here accordingly?  
[Shivan Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Wurm) also has a mana cost of ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), not ![7](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=7&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), has it?  
Of course - the latter uses a rare slot. But was that a reason to [chimney imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=chimney imp) this common?

Shivan Wurm also has a mana cost of , not , has it?
Of course - the latter uses a rare slot. But was that a reason to chimney imp this common?

posts.post_content: Yeah, I don't get this card. You could certainly use it to your advantage to bounce back a creature that does something good when it comes into play. Still, it's generally a drawback and usually found on cards that are undercosted, such as Kor Skyfisher.
